page.title: 12EDUCATION - School aims 1.
page.content: An extract from the Duddon School 'Curriculum Statement' first issued in June,1984. {Currently perceived aims: {To create}a happy, secure environment for the children. {To provide}stimulating classrooms and grounds to interest the children. {To learn}to live and work together in a variety of ways; to develop controlled and well-mannered behaviour acceptable within our society by providing a caring environment which recognises the needs of disabled and disadvantaged persons. {To involve}parents in the education of their children. {To recognise}and encourage Christian values, whilst appreciating the diversity of races, religions and ways of life.
